class_notes:
For History Honors students accepted into Honors program only.


(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)


The goal of this course is to prepare advanced undergraduates to complete an honors thesis in history. The seminar grounds students in the basic competencies of historical research and guides participants through the process of designing a research project. The seminar will also be a collaborative space in which participants will share their research plans and provide constructive feedback on the work of others.
Over the course of the semester, students will select a research topic, develop a set of research questions and research strategy, and identify relevant primary and secondary sources. The seminar requires demands full participation and steady progress, as evidenced by the incremental, structured set of assignments. Each weekly meeting of the course focuses on a component of the research planning process. By the end of the semester, seminar participants will complete a thesis proposal for submission to the History Department Honors Program.
course_description: For honors students in history. Addresses historiographical and methodological issues, and offers practical guidance in thesis design and research, with details and emphases at discretion of instructor.
